title: Astronomical Instrumentation and Observational Techniques
description: The course will explore a variety of astrophysical instruments and techniques from detection of the shortest to the longest wavelengths of light. Topics include coordinates/time; statistics of light; basic optics; telescopes; instrument design, spectrographs; interferometry; detectors; sub-mm/radio techniques; adaptive optics; astroparticle and gravitational wave facilities. Renumbered from PHYS 229. Students may not receive credit for PHYA 229 and PHYS 229.
